text: AI researchers these days have so many
amazing new ideas to bring AI from the
lab into the real world to do that we
need enormous amounts of compute project
Saba is showing up at just the right
time to help us do
that project saber is a joint initiative
between AWS and Nvidia to build one of
the world's largest AI supercomputers
with over 20,000 black world gpus all
running within AWS data
centers Nvidia and AWS have a
long-standing history of deep technical
co-innovation this first ofit kind
supercomputer is being built using the
new envidia gb200 Envy link 72 a system
featuring fifth generation Envy link
which connects 10,000 Nvidia Grace CPUs
to the gpus and it's capable of 414 exif
flops of compute project sa is hosted
exclusively on AWS via djx Cloud project
saber comes with many engineering
challenges because we're really pushing
the boundaries of what's been possible
in AI the move from our current 8 gpus
in a single peer-to-peer Envy link mesh
single server to 72 gpus is an order of
magnitude increase in just one product
generation the low latency and low
Jitter for inter instance Communications
provided by our ec2 Ultra clusters and
AWS elastic fabric adapter or EFA enable
us to connect over 20,000 black black
World gpus in a single
cluster now when optimizing even small
amounts of latency introduced by
software and operating systems can be
meaningful which is why EFA works with
Nitro to bypass the kernel networking
stack to provide the lowest latency and
highest throughput networking in AWS AWS
infrastructure and services have
security features in place to give
customers control over their data and
using the AWS Nitro system with gb200
provides an endtoend encrypted flow
including isolation of AI data providing
some of the strongest security
guarantees in the industry
today ultimately our collaboration will
democratize access for any researcher to
supercomputing researchers can run short
burst of exaflop scale compute to solve
The World's Hardest problems such as
nvidia's Earth 2 climate prediction
creating digital twins for manufacturing
and Robotics designing the next
generation of autonomous Vehicle Systems
or drug Discovery to bring treatments to
patients living with hard- to treat
diseases I've been doing AI research on
AWS for over 10 years and because of
that experience I have confidence that
AWS will continue to provide highly
scalable reliable infrastructure that we
need for tomorrow's generative AI
[Music]
